26namespace webrtc {
27
28namespace {
29
30// Amount the microphone level is lowered with every clipping event.
31const int kClippedLevelStep = 15;
32// Proportion of clipped samples required to declare a clipping event.
33const float kClippedRatioThreshold = 0.1f;
34// Time in frames to wait after a clipping event before checking again.
35const int kClippedWaitFrames = 300;
36
37// Amount of error we tolerate in the microphone level (presumably due to OS
38// quantization) before we assume the user has manually adjusted the microphone.
39const int kLevelQuantizationSlack = 25;
40
41const int kDefaultCompressionGain = 7;
42const int kMaxCompressionGain = 12;
43const int kMinCompressionGain = 2;
44// Controls the rate of compression changes towards the target.
45const float kCompressionGainStep = 0.05f;
46
47const int kMaxMicLevel = 255;
48static_assert(kGainMapSize > kMaxMicLevel, "gain map too small");
49const int kMinMicLevel = 12;
50
51// Prevent very large microphone level changes.
52const int kMaxResidualGainChange = 15;
53
54// Maximum additional gain allowed to compensate for microphone level
55// restrictions from clipping events.
56const int kSurplusCompressionGain = 6;
57
58// Returns whether a fall-back solution to choose the maximum level should be
59// chosen.
60bool UseMaxAnalogChannelLevel() {
61 return field_trial::IsEnabled("WebRTC-UseMaxAnalogAgcChannelLevel");
62}
63
64// Returns kMinMicLevel if no field trial exists or if it has been disabled.
65// Returns a value between 0 and 255 depending on the field-trial string.
66// Example: 'WebRTC-Audio-AgcMinMicLevelExperiment/Enabled-80' => returns 80.
67int GetMinMicLevel() {
68 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] GetMinMicLevel";
69 constexpr char kMinMicLevelFieldTrial[] =
70 "WebRTC-Audio-AgcMinMicLevelExperiment";
71 if (!webrtc::field_trial::IsEnabled(kMinMicLevelFieldTrial)) {
72 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] Using default min mic level: " << kMinMicLevel;
73 return kMinMicLevel;
74 }
75 const auto field_trial_string =
76 webrtc::field_trial::FindFullName(kMinMicLevelFieldTrial);
77 int min_mic_level = -1;
78 sscanf(field_trial_string.c_str(), "Enabled-%d", &min_mic_level);
79 if (min_mic_level >= 0 && min_mic_level <= 255) {
80 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] Experimental min mic level: " << min_mic_level;
81 return min_mic_level;
82 } else {
83 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "[agc] Invalid parameter for "
84 << kMinMicLevelFieldTrial << ", ignored.";
85 return kMinMicLevel;
86 }
87}
88
89int ClampLevel(int mic_level, int min_mic_level) {
90 return rtc::SafeClamp(mic_level, min_mic_level, kMaxMicLevel);
91}
92
93int LevelFromGainError(int gain_error, int level, int min_mic_level) {
94 RTC_DCHECK_GE(level, 0);
95 RTC_DCHECK_LE(level, kMaxMicLevel);
96 if (gain_error == 0) {
97 return level;
98 }
99
100 int new_level = level;
101 if (gain_error > 0) {
102 while (kGainMap[new_level] - kGainMap[level] < gain_error &&
103 new_level < kMaxMicLevel) {
104 ++new_level;
105 }
106 } else {
107 while (kGainMap[new_level] - kGainMap[level] > gain_error &&
108 new_level > min_mic_level) {
109 --new_level;
110 }
111 }
112 return new_level;
113}
114
115// Returns the proportion of samples in the buffer which are at full-scale
116// (and presumably clipped).
117float ComputeClippedRatio(const float* const* audio,
118 size_t num_channels,
119 size_t samples_per_channel) {
120 RTC_DCHECK_GT(samples_per_channel, 0);
121 int num_clipped = 0;
122 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_channels; ++ch) {
123 int num_clipped_in_ch = 0;
124 for (size_t i = 0; i < samples_per_channel; ++i) {
125 RTC_DCHECK(audio[ch]);
126 if (audio[ch][i] >= 32767.f || audio[ch][i] <= -32768.f) {
127 ++num_clipped_in_ch;
128 }
129 }
130 num_clipped = std::max(num_clipped, num_clipped_in_ch);
131 }
132 return static_cast<float>(num_clipped) / (samples_per_channel);
133}
134
135} // namespace
136
137MonoAgc::MonoAgc(ApmDataDumper* data_dumper,
138 int startup_min_level,
139 int clipped_level_min,
140 bool disable_digital_adaptive,
141 int min_mic_level)
142 : min_mic_level_(min_mic_level),
143 disable_digital_adaptive_(disable_digital_adaptive),
144 agc_(std::make_unique<Agc>()),
145 max_level_(kMaxMicLevel),
146 max_compression_gain_(kMaxCompressionGain),
147 target_compression_(kDefaultCompressionGain),
148 compression_(target_compression_),
149 compression_accumulator_(compression_),
150 startup_min_level_(ClampLevel(startup_min_level, min_mic_level_)),
151 clipped_level_min_(clipped_level_min) {}
152
153MonoAgc::~MonoAgc() = default;
154
155void MonoAgc::Initialize() {
156 max_level_ = kMaxMicLevel;
157 max_compression_gain_ = kMaxCompressionGain;
158 target_compression_ = disable_digital_adaptive_ ? 0 : kDefaultCompressionGain;
159 compression_ = disable_digital_adaptive_ ? 0 : target_compression_;
160 compression_accumulator_ = compression_;
161 capture_output_used_ = true;
162 check_volume_on_next_process_ = true;
163}
164
165void MonoAgc::Process(const int16_t* audio,
166 size_t samples_per_channel,
167 int sample_rate_hz) {
168 new_compression_to_set_ = absl::nullopt;
169
170 if (check_volume_on_next_process_) {
171 check_volume_on_next_process_ = false;
172 // We have to wait until the first process call to check the volume,
173 // because Chromium doesn't guarantee it to be valid any earlier.
174 CheckVolumeAndReset();
175 }
176
177 agc_->Process(audio, samples_per_channel, sample_rate_hz);
178
179 UpdateGain();
180 if (!disable_digital_adaptive_) {
181 UpdateCompressor();
182 }
183}
184
185void MonoAgc::HandleClipping() {
186 // Always decrease the maximum level, even if the current level is below
187 // threshold.
188 SetMaxLevel(std::max(clipped_level_min_, max_level_ - kClippedLevelStep));
189 if (log_to_histograms_) {
190 RTC_HISTOGRAM_BOOLEAN("WebRTC.Audio.AgcClippingAdjustmentAllowed",
191 level_ - kClippedLevelStep >= clipped_level_min_);
192 }
193 if (level_ > clipped_level_min_) {
194 // Don't try to adjust the level if we're already below the limit. As
195 // a consequence, if the user has brought the level above the limit, we
196 // will still not react until the postproc updates the level.
197 SetLevel(std::max(clipped_level_min_, level_ - kClippedLevelStep));
198 // Reset the AGCs for all channels since the level has changed.
199 agc_->Reset();
200 }
201}
202
203void MonoAgc::SetLevel(int new_level) {
204 int voe_level = stream_analog_level_;
205 if (voe_level == 0) {
206 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO)
207 << "[agc] VolumeCallbacks returned level=0, taking no action.";
208 return;
209 }
210 if (voe_level < 0 || voe_level > kMaxMicLevel) {
211 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "VolumeCallbacks returned an invalid level="
212 << voe_level;
213 return;
214 }
215
216 if (voe_level > level_ + kLevelQuantizationSlack ||
217 voe_level < level_ - kLevelQuantizationSlack) {
218 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] Mic volume was manually adjusted. Updating "
219 "stored level from "
220 << level_ << " to " << voe_level;
221 level_ = voe_level;
222 // Always allow the user to increase the volume.
223 if (level_ > max_level_) {
224 SetMaxLevel(level_);
225 }
226 // Take no action in this case, since we can't be sure when the volume
227 // was manually adjusted. The compressor will still provide some of the
228 // desired gain change.
229 agc_->Reset();
230
231 return;
232 }
233
234 new_level = std::min(new_level, max_level_);
235 if (new_level == level_) {
236 return;
237 }
238
239 stream_analog_level_ = new_level;
240 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] voe_level=" << voe_level << ", level_=" << level_
241 << ", new_level=" << new_level;
242 level_ = new_level;
243}
244
245void MonoAgc::SetMaxLevel(int level) {
246 RTC_DCHECK_GE(level, clipped_level_min_);
247 max_level_ = level;
248 // Scale the |kSurplusCompressionGain| linearly across the restricted
249 // level range.
250 max_compression_gain_ =
251 kMaxCompressionGain + std::floor((1.f * kMaxMicLevel - max_level_) /
252 (kMaxMicLevel - clipped_level_min_) *
253 kSurplusCompressionGain +
254 0.5f);
255 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] max_level_=" << max_level_
256 << ", max_compression_gain_=" << max_compression_gain_;
257}
258
259void MonoAgc::HandleCaptureOutputUsedChange(bool capture_output_used) {
260 if (capture_output_used_ == capture_output_used) {
261 return;
262 }
263 capture_output_used_ = capture_output_used;
264
265 if (capture_output_used) {
266 // When we start using the output, we should reset things to be safe.
267 check_volume_on_next_process_ = true;
268 }
269}
270
271int MonoAgc::CheckVolumeAndReset() {
272 int level = stream_analog_level_;
273 // Reasons for taking action at startup:
274 // 1) A person starting a call is expected to be heard.
275 // 2) Independent of interpretation of |level| == 0 we should raise it so the
276 // AGC can do its job properly.
277 if (level == 0 && !startup_) {
278 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO)
279 << "[agc] VolumeCallbacks returned level=0, taking no action.";
280 return 0;
281 }
282 if (level < 0 || level > kMaxMicLevel) {
283 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "[agc] VolumeCallbacks returned an invalid level="
284 << level;
285 return -1;
286 }
287 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] Initial GetMicVolume()=" << level;
288
289 int minLevel = startup_ ? startup_min_level_ : min_mic_level_;
290 if (level < minLevel) {
291 level = minLevel;
292 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] Initial volume too low, raising to " << level;
293 stream_analog_level_ = level;
294 }
295 agc_->Reset();
296 level_ = level;
297 startup_ = false;
298 return 0;
299}
300
301// Requests the RMS error from AGC and distributes the required gain change
302// between the digital compression stage and volume slider. We use the
303// compressor first, providing a slack region around the current slider
304// position to reduce movement.
305//
306// If the slider needs to be moved, we check first if the user has adjusted
307// it, in which case we take no action and cache the updated level.
308void MonoAgc::UpdateGain() {
309 int rms_error = 0;
310 if (!agc_->GetRmsErrorDb(&rms_error)) {
311 // No error update ready.
312 return;
313 }
314 // The compressor will always add at least kMinCompressionGain. In effect,
315 // this adjusts our target gain upward by the same amount and rms_error
316 // needs to reflect that.
317 rms_error += kMinCompressionGain;
318
319 // Handle as much error as possible with the compressor first.
320 int raw_compression =
321 rtc::SafeClamp(rms_error, kMinCompressionGain, max_compression_gain_);
322
323 // Deemphasize the compression gain error. Move halfway between the current
324 // target and the newly received target. This serves to soften perceptible
325 // intra-talkspurt adjustments, at the cost of some adaptation speed.
326 if ((raw_compression == max_compression_gain_ &&
327 target_compression_ == max_compression_gain_ - 1) ||
328 (raw_compression == kMinCompressionGain &&
329 target_compression_ == kMinCompressionGain + 1)) {
330 // Special case to allow the target to reach the endpoints of the
331 // compression range. The deemphasis would otherwise halt it at 1 dB shy.
332 target_compression_ = raw_compression;
333 } else {
334 target_compression_ =
335 (raw_compression - target_compression_) / 2 + target_compression_;
336 }
337
338 // Residual error will be handled by adjusting the volume slider. Use the
339 // raw rather than deemphasized compression here as we would otherwise
340 // shrink the amount of slack the compressor provides.
341 const int residual_gain =
342 rtc::SafeClamp(rms_error - raw_compression, -kMaxResidualGainChange,
343 kMaxResidualGainChange);
344 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] rms_error=" << rms_error
345 << ", target_compression=" << target_compression_
346 << ", residual_gain=" << residual_gain;
347 if (residual_gain == 0)
348 return;
349
350 int old_level = level_;
351 SetLevel(LevelFromGainError(residual_gain, level_, min_mic_level_));
352 if (old_level != level_) {
353 // level_ was updated by SetLevel; log the new value.
354 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR("WebRTC.Audio.AgcSetLevel", level_, 1,
355 kMaxMicLevel, 50);
356 // Reset the AGC since the level has changed.
357 agc_->Reset();
358 }
359}
360
361void MonoAgc::UpdateCompressor() {
362 calls_since_last_gain_log_++;
363 if (calls_since_last_gain_log_ == 100) {
364 calls_since_last_gain_log_ = 0;
365 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR("WebRTC.Audio.Agc.DigitalGainApplied",
366 compression_, 0, kMaxCompressionGain,
367 kMaxCompressionGain + 1);
368 }
369 if (compression_ == target_compression_) {
370 return;
371 }
372
373 // Adapt the compression gain slowly towards the target, in order to avoid
374 // highly perceptible changes.
375 if (target_compression_ > compression_) {
376 compression_accumulator_ += kCompressionGainStep;
377 } else {
378 compression_accumulator_ -= kCompressionGainStep;
379 }
380
381 // The compressor accepts integer gains in dB. Adjust the gain when
382 // we've come within half a stepsize of the nearest integer. (We don't
383 // check for equality due to potential floating point imprecision).
384 int new_compression = compression_;
385 int nearest_neighbor = std::floor(compression_accumulator_ + 0.5);
386 if (std::fabs(compression_accumulator_ - nearest_neighbor) <
387 kCompressionGainStep / 2) {
388 new_compression = nearest_neighbor;
389 }
390
391 // Set the new compression gain.
392 if (new_compression != compression_) {
393 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR("WebRTC.Audio.Agc.DigitalGainUpdated",
394 new_compression, 0, kMaxCompressionGain,
395 kMaxCompressionGain + 1);
396 compression_ = new_compression;
397 compression_accumulator_ = new_compression;
398 new_compression_to_set_ = compression_;
399 }
400}
401
402int AgcManagerDirect::instance_counter_ = 0;
403
404AgcManagerDirect::AgcManagerDirect(Agc* agc,
405 int startup_min_level,
406 int clipped_level_min,
407 int sample_rate_hz)
408 : AgcManagerDirect(/*num_capture_channels*/ 1,
409 startup_min_level,
410 clipped_level_min,
411 /*disable_digital_adaptive*/ false,
412 sample_rate_hz) {
413 RTC_DCHECK(channel_agcs_[0]);
414 RTC_DCHECK(agc);
415 channel_agcs_[0]->set_agc(agc);
416}
417
418AgcManagerDirect::AgcManagerDirect(int num_capture_channels,
419 int startup_min_level,
420 int clipped_level_min,
421 bool disable_digital_adaptive,
422 int sample_rate_hz)
423 : data_dumper_(
424 new ApmDataDumper(rtc::AtomicOps::Increment(&instance_counter_))),
425 use_min_channel_level_(!UseMaxAnalogChannelLevel()),
426 sample_rate_hz_(sample_rate_hz),
427 num_capture_channels_(num_capture_channels),
428 disable_digital_adaptive_(disable_digital_adaptive),
429 frames_since_clipped_(kClippedWaitFrames),
430 capture_output_used_(true),
431 channel_agcs_(num_capture_channels),
432 new_compressions_to_set_(num_capture_channels) {
433 const int min_mic_level = GetMinMicLevel();
434 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
435 ApmDataDumper* data_dumper_ch = ch == 0 ? data_dumper_.get() : nullptr;
436
437 channel_agcs_[ch] = std::make_unique<MonoAgc>(
438 data_dumper_ch, startup_min_level, clipped_level_min,
439 disable_digital_adaptive_, min_mic_level);
440 }
441 RTC_DCHECK_LT(0, channel_agcs_.size());
442 channel_agcs_[0]->ActivateLogging();
443}
444
445AgcManagerDirect::~AgcManagerDirect() {}
446
447void AgcManagerDirect::Initialize() {
448 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "AgcManagerDirect::Initialize";
449 data_dumper_->InitiateNewSetOfRecordings();
450 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
451 channel_agcs_[ch]->Initialize();
452 }
453 capture_output_used_ = true;
454
455 AggregateChannelLevels();
456}
457
458void AgcManagerDirect::SetupDigitalGainControl(
459 GainControl* gain_control) const {
460 RTC_DCHECK(gain_control);
461 if (gain_control->set_mode(GainControl::kFixedDigital) != 0) {
462 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "set_mode(GainControl::kFixedDigital) failed.";
463 }
464 const int target_level_dbfs = disable_digital_adaptive_ ? 0 : 2;
465 if (gain_control->set_target_level_dbfs(target_level_dbfs) != 0) {
466 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "set_target_level_dbfs() failed.";
467 }
468 const int compression_gain_db =
469 disable_digital_adaptive_ ? 0 : kDefaultCompressionGain;
470 if (gain_control->set_compression_gain_db(compression_gain_db) != 0) {
471 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "set_compression_gain_db() failed.";
472 }
473 const bool enable_limiter = !disable_digital_adaptive_;
474 if (gain_control->enable_limiter(enable_limiter) != 0) {
475 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "enable_limiter() failed.";
476 }
477}
478
479void AgcManagerDirect::AnalyzePreProcess(const AudioBuffer* audio) {
480 RTC_DCHECK(audio);
481 AnalyzePreProcess(audio->channels_const(), audio->num_frames());
482}
483
484void AgcManagerDirect::AnalyzePreProcess(const float* const* audio,
485 size_t samples_per_channel) {
486 RTC_DCHECK(audio);
487 AggregateChannelLevels();
488 if (!capture_output_used_) {
489 return;
490 }
491
492 if (frames_since_clipped_ < kClippedWaitFrames) {
493 ++frames_since_clipped_;
494 return;
495 }
496
497 // Check for clipped samples, as the AGC has difficulty detecting pitch
498 // under clipping distortion. We do this in the preprocessing phase in order
499 // to catch clipped echo as well.
500 //
501 // If we find a sufficiently clipped frame, drop the current microphone level
502 // and enforce a new maximum level, dropped the same amount from the current
503 // maximum. This harsh treatment is an effort to avoid repeated clipped echo
504 // events. As compensation for this restriction, the maximum compression
505 // gain is increased, through SetMaxLevel().
506 float clipped_ratio =
507 ComputeClippedRatio(audio, num_capture_channels_, samples_per_channel);
508
509 if (clipped_ratio > kClippedRatioThreshold) {
510 RTC_DLOG(LS_INFO) << "[agc] Clipping detected. clipped_ratio="
511 << clipped_ratio;
512 for (auto& state_ch : channel_agcs_) {
513 state_ch->HandleClipping();
514 }
515 frames_since_clipped_ = 0;
516 }
517 AggregateChannelLevels();
518}
519
520void AgcManagerDirect::Process(const AudioBuffer* audio) {
521 AggregateChannelLevels();
522
523 if (!capture_output_used_) {
524 return;
525 }
526
527 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
528 int16_t* audio_use = nullptr;
529 std::array<int16_t, AudioBuffer::kMaxSampleRate / 100> audio_data;
530 int num_frames_per_band;
531 if (audio) {
532 FloatS16ToS16(audio->split_bands_const_f(ch)[0],
533 audio->num_frames_per_band(), audio_data.data());
534 audio_use = audio_data.data();
535 num_frames_per_band = audio->num_frames_per_band();
536 } else {
537 // Only used for testing.
538 // TODO(peah): Change unittests to only allow on non-null audio input.
539 num_frames_per_band = 320;
540 }
541 channel_agcs_[ch]->Process(audio_use, num_frames_per_band, sample_rate_hz_);
542 new_compressions_to_set_[ch] = channel_agcs_[ch]->new_compression();
543 }
544
545 AggregateChannelLevels();
546}
547
548absl::optional<int> AgcManagerDirect::GetDigitalComressionGain() {
549 return new_compressions_to_set_[channel_controlling_gain_];
550}
551
552void AgcManagerDirect::HandleCaptureOutputUsedChange(bool capture_output_used) {
553 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
554 channel_agcs_[ch]->HandleCaptureOutputUsedChange(capture_output_used);
555 }
556 capture_output_used_ = capture_output_used;
557}
558
559float AgcManagerDirect::voice_probability() const {
560 float max_prob = 0.f;
561 for (const auto& state_ch : channel_agcs_) {
562 max_prob = std::max(max_prob, state_ch->voice_probability());
563 }
564
565 return max_prob;
566}
567
568void AgcManagerDirect::set_stream_analog_level(int level) {
569 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
570 channel_agcs_[ch]->set_stream_analog_level(level);
571 }
572
573 AggregateChannelLevels();
574}
575
576void AgcManagerDirect::AggregateChannelLevels() {
577 stream_analog_level_ = channel_agcs_[0]->stream_analog_level();
578 channel_controlling_gain_ = 0;
579 if (use_min_channel_level_) {
580 for (size_t ch = 1; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
581 int level = channel_agcs_[ch]->stream_analog_level();
582 if (level < stream_analog_level_) {
583 stream_analog_level_ = level;
584 channel_controlling_gain_ = static_cast<int>(ch);
585 }
586 }
587 } else {
588 for (size_t ch = 1; ch < channel_agcs_.size(); ++ch) {
589 int level = channel_agcs_[ch]->stream_analog_level();
590 if (level > stream_analog_level_) {
591 stream_analog_level_ = level;
592 channel_controlling_gain_ = static_cast<int>(ch);
593 }
594 }
595 }
596}
